channel.title: Clarification Of Sound File Name
channel.description:
I was rummaging through the BM sound folder and found what appears to be an error in a file name, as follows:
At location "BMS/sound/BMS_scripted/bunker" is a file named "bunker_esplode.wav". Is this correct or should it in fact be "bunker_explode.wav"?
The "S" and "X" keys are situated very close to each other on a keyboard, so I'm wondering if this is just a typing error.
Thanks in advance for your clarification.

item.title: Clarification Of Sound File Name
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
a+++ thread, would read again

Read full topic

item.title: Clarification Of Sound File Name

item.description:
I was rummaging through the BM sound folder and found what appears to be an error in a file name, as follows:

At location “BMS/sound/BMS_scripted/bunker” is a file named “bunker_esplode.wav”. Is this correct or should it in fact be “bunker_explode.wav”?

The “S” and “X” keys are situated very close to each other on a keyboard, so I’m wondering if this is just a typing error.

Thanks in advance for your clarification.
